verses.name: Job 30:6
verses.text: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.

verses.name: Job 30:7
verses.text: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

verses.name: Job 30:8
verses.text: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

verses.name: Job 30:9
verses.text: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

verses.name: Job 30:10
verses.text: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

verses.name: Job 30:11
verses.text: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
